title: Syna Schreiber
text:
Syna Schreiber (born 20 November 1978) is a former professional <a href="tennis">tennis</a> player from Germany. Up until her marriage in 2003, she competed under her maiden name Syna Schmidle.
Biography.
Schreiber was born in <a href="Freiburg%20im%20Breisgau">Freiburg im Breisgau</a>, the daughter of tennis instructor Wolfram, who began teaching her when she was four.
When she was aged 14 she received a wildcard into the main draw of a WTA tournament in Leipzig and played her first tour match against <a href="Steffi%20Graf">Steffi Graf</a>.
In 1997 she won a $25,000 ITF tournament in Flensburg and that year reached her highest career ranking of 152 in the world.
As a doubles player she made WTA Tour semi-finals at the <a href="1999%20Croatian%20Bol%20Ladies%20Open">1999 Croatian Bol Ladies Open</a> with <a href="Barbara%20Schwartz%20%28tennis%29">Barbara Schwartz</a> and <a href="Internazionali%20Femminili%20di%20Palermo">Palermo</a> in 2001 partnering <a href="Antonella%20Serra%20Zanetti">Antonella Serra Zanetti</a>. She won eight doubles titles on the ITF circuit.
She made her only <a href="Grand%20Slam%20%28tennis%29">grand slam</a> main draw appearance at the <a href="2000%20US%20Open%20%28tennis%29">2000 US Open</a>, as a qualifier in the women's doubles with <a href="Maja%20Matev%C5%BEi%C4%8D">Maja Matevžič</a>.
